content.title: 영어 조동사 및 조동사 + have + 과거분사 학습

topics.subtitle: Will: 미래의 예측이나 계획
topics.explanation: 미래에 일어날 가능성이 있거나 계획된 행동을 표현할 때 사용

examples.english: They will visit Japan next year.

examples.korean: 그들은 내년에 일본을 방문하지 않을 거예요.
examples.english: They won’t visit Japan next year.
Will they visit Japan next year?
Won’t they visit Japan next year?

topics.subtitle: Will: 즉흥적인 결정
topics.explanation: 말하는 순간 결정된 행동을 표현할 때 사용

examples.english: I will call you tonight.

examples.korean: 오늘 밤 너한테 전화 안 할게요.
examples.english: I won’t call you tonight.
Will you call me tonight?

examples.korean: 오늘 밤 나한테 전화 안 할 거야?
examples.english: Won’t you call me tonight?

topics.subtitle: Will: 요청
topics.explanation: 정중한 요청이나 의지를 표현할 때 사용

examples.english: I will take care of it.
I won’t bother you again.
Will you pass me the salt?
Won’t you pass me the salt?

topics.subtitle: Can: 능력
topics.explanation: 어떤 일을 할 수 있는 능력을 표현할 때 사용

examples.korean: 그녀는 피아노를 아름답게 연주할 수 있어요.
examples.english: She can play the piano beautifully.
She can’t play the piano.
Can she play the piano?
Can’t she play the piano?

topics.subtitle: Can: 허락
topics.explanation: 허락이나 금지를 표현할 때 사용

examples.english: You can use my laptop.
You can’t use my phone.
Can I use your laptop?
Can’t I use your laptop?

topics.subtitle: Could: 과거의 능력
topics.explanation: 과거의 능력을 표현할 때 사용

examples.korean: 그는 강을 건너 수영할 수 있었어요.
examples.english: He could swim across the river.

examples.korean: 그는 강을 건너 수영할 수 없었어요.
examples.english: He couldn’t swim across the river.

examples.korean: 그가 강을 건너 수영할 수 있었어?
examples.english: Could he swim across the river?

examples.korean: 그가 강을 건너 수영할 수 없었어?
examples.english: Couldn’t he swim across the river?

topics.subtitle: Could: 정중한 요청
topics.explanation: 정중한 요청을 할 때 사용

examples.english: I could assist you with the project.
I couldn’t assist you today.
Could you open the door?
Couldn’t you open the door?

topics.subtitle: Could: 낮은 가능성
topics.explanation: 낮은 가능성을 나타낼 때 사용

examples.english: It could snow this evening.

examples.korean: 오늘 저녁에 눈이 오지 않을 거예요.
examples.english: It couldn’t snow this evening.
Could it snow this evening?
Couldn’t it snow this evening?

topics.subtitle: Should: 조언이나 권고
topics.explanation: 조언이나 권고를 할 때 사용

examples.english: You should exercise regularly.

examples.korean: 너는 설탕을 너무 많이 먹으면 안 돼요.
examples.english: You shouldn’t eat too much sugar.
Should I exercise regularly?
Shouldn’t I exercise regularly?

topics.subtitle: Should: 기대나 예측
topics.explanation: 기대되거나 예측되는 상황을 표현할 때 사용

examples.english: The package should arrive tomorrow.
The package shouldn’t arrive late.
Should the package arrive tomorrow?
Shouldn’t the package arrive tomorrow?

topics.subtitle: Would: 가정법 (비현실적 상황)
topics.explanation: 비현실적인 가정 상황을 표현할 때 사용

examples.english: I would buy a car if I were rich.

examples.korean: 내가 가난하면 차를 사지 않을 거예요.
examples.english: I wouldn’t buy a car if I were poor.
Would you buy a car if you were rich?

examples.korean: 네가 부자라면 차를 사지 않을 거야?
examples.english: Wouldn’t you buy a car if you were rich?

topics.subtitle: Would: 정중한 요청
topics.explanation: 정중한 요청을 표현할 때 사용

examples.english: I would like a glass of water.
I wouldn’t like coffee now.
Would you mind closing the window?
Wouldn’t you mind closing the window?

topics.subtitle: Would: 과거의 습관
topics.explanation: 과거의 반복적인 행동이나 습관을 표현할 때 사용

examples.korean: 그녀는 매주 일요일에 할머니를 방문하곤 했어요.
examples.english: She would visit her grandma every Sunday.

examples.korean: 그녀는 할머니를 자주 방문하지 않곤 했어요.
examples.english: She wouldn’t visit her grandma often.

examples.korean: 그녀가 매주 일요일에 할머니를 방문하곤 했어?
examples.english: Would she visit her grandma every Sunday?

examples.korean: 그녀가 매주 일요일에 할머니를 방문하지 않곤 했어?
examples.english: Wouldn’t she visit her grandma every Sunday?

topics.subtitle: Must: 의무
topics.explanation: 의무나 필수적인 행동을 표현할 때 사용

examples.english: You must submit the report by tomorrow.
You mustn’t talk during the exam.
Must I submit the report by tomorrow?

examples.korean: 내가 내일까지 보고서를 제출하면 안 돼?
examples.english: Mustn’t I submit the report by tomorrow?

topics.subtitle: Must: 논리적 추론
topics.explanation: 논리적 추론을 통해 확신을 표현할 때 사용

examples.english: He must be at the office now.
He can’t be at the office now.
Must he be at the office now?
Can’t he be at the office now?

topics.subtitle: Might: 낮은 가능성
topics.explanation: 낮은 가능성을 나타낼 때 사용

examples.english: She might join us for dinner.

examples.korean: 그녀가 저녁에 우리와 함께하지 않을지도 몰라요.
examples.english: She might not join us for dinner.
Might she join us for dinner?
Might she not join us for dinner?

topics.subtitle: May: 가능성
topics.explanation: 가능성을 나타낼 때 사용

examples.english: It may rain this afternoon.

examples.korean: 오늘 오후에 비가 안 올지도 몰라요.
examples.english: It may not rain this afternoon.
May it rain this afternoon?
May it not rain this afternoon?

topics.subtitle: May: 정중한 허락
topics.explanation: 정중한 허락이나 금지를 표현할 때 사용

examples.english: You may leave the room now.
You may not leave the room now.
May I leave the room now?
May I not leave the room now?

topics.subtitle: Be able to: 능력
topics.explanation: 능력을 표현하며, 시제 변화가 가능한 표현 (Can과 유사)

examples.korean: 그녀는 복잡한 문제를 풀 수 있어요.
examples.english: She is able to solve complex problems.

examples.korean: 그녀는 복잡한 문제를 풀 수 없어요.
examples.english: She isn’t able to solve complex problems.

examples.korean: 그녀가 복잡한 문제를 풀 수 있어?
examples.english: Is she able to solve complex problems?

examples.korean: 그녀가 복잡한 문제를 풀 수 없어?
examples.english: Isn’t she able to solve complex problems?

topics.subtitle: Be able to: 특정 상황에서의 가능성
topics.explanation: 특정 상황에서 가능했던 행동을 표현할 때 사용

examples.korean: 우리는 마지막 기차를 탈 수 있었어요.
examples.english: We were able to catch the last train.

examples.korean: 우리는 마지막 기차를 탈 수 없었어요.
examples.english: We weren’t able to catch the last train.

examples.korean: 너 마지막 기차를 탈 수 있었어?
examples.english: Were you able to catch the last train?

examples.korean: 너 마지막 기차를 탈 수 없었어?
examples.english: Weren’t you able to catch the last train?

topics.subtitle: Used to: 과거의 습관
topics.explanation: 과거의 반복적인 행동이나 습관을 표현할 때 사용

examples.korean: 나는 매주 주말에 축구를 하곤 했어요.
examples.english: I used to play soccer every weekend.
I didn’t use to play soccer.
Did you use to play soccer?
Didn’t you use to play soccer?

topics.subtitle: Used to: 과거의 상태
topics.explanation: 과거의 지속적인 상태를 표현할 때 사용

examples.english: This park used to be empty.

examples.korean: 이 공원은 예전에 비어 있지 않았어요.
examples.english: This park didn’t use to be empty.
Did this park use to be empty?

examples.korean: 이 공원이 예전에 비어 있지 않았어?
examples.english: Didn’t this park use to be empty?

topics.subtitle: Must have + 과거분사: 과거의 논리적 추론
topics.explanation: 과거의 상황에 대해 논리적 추론을 할 때 사용

examples.english: She must have left early.
She can’t have left early.
Must she have left early?
Can’t she have left early?

topics.subtitle: Should have + 과거분사: 과거의 후회나 권고
topics.explanation: 과거에 했어야 했던 행동이나 후회를 표현할 때 사용

examples.english: You should have called me.
You shouldn’t have ignored the warning.
Should I have called you?
Shouldn’t I have called you?

topics.subtitle: Might have + 과거분사: 과거의 낮은 가능성
topics.explanation: 과거에 일어났을 가능성이 낮은 상황을 표현할 때 사용

examples.english: He might have forgotten the meeting.
He might not have forgotten the meeting.
Might he have forgotten the meeting?
Might he not have forgotten the meeting?

topics.subtitle: May have + 과거분사: 과거의 가능성
topics.explanation: 과거에 일어났을 가능성을 표현할 때 사용

examples.english: They may have missed the flight.
They may not have missed the flight.
May they have missed the flight?
May they not have missed the flight?

topics.subtitle: Could have + 과거분사: 과거의 가능했지만 하지 않은 일
topics.explanation: 과거에 가능했지만 실제로 하지 않은 행동을 표현할 때 사용

examples.korean: 너는 나에게 진실을 말할 수 있었어.
examples.english: You could have told me the truth.

examples.korean: 너는 나에게 더 일찍 말할 수 없었어.
examples.english: You couldn’t have told me earlier.

examples.korean: 너 나에게 진실을 말할 수 있었어?
examples.english: Could you have told me the truth?
Couldn’t you have told me the truth?

topics.subtitle: Would have + 과거분사: 과거의 가정 상황
topics.explanation: 과거의 비현실적인 가정 상황을 표현할 때 사용

examples.english: I would have attended if I had time.
I wouldn’t have attended if I was busy.
Would you have attended if you had time?
Wouldn’t you have attended if you had time?
